question_details.query: What actions can be taken to reduce predation by marine mammals at aquaculture systems?

summary_details.relevant_summary: Identified actions include: replacing or repairing damaged anti-predator nets, which in one site comparison study at salmon farms was associated with fewer salmon losses to harbour seal predation (2774); modifying anti-predator nets, for which no studies have directly evaluated effects on marine/freshwater mammals (2743); minimizing food waste at aquaculture systems, for which no studies have directly evaluated effects on marine/freshwater mammals (2744); modifying aquaculture gear, for which no studies have directly evaluated effects on marine/freshwater mammals (2742); and translocating mammals away from aquaculture systems, where two studies reported that more than half or nearly all translocated Australian and New Zealand fur seals returned to salmon farms (2776).

summary_statements: Replacing or repairing damaged anti-predator nets is an identified action to reduce predation at aquaculture systems.
One site comparison study at salmon farms found that replacing or repairing damaged anti-predator nets was associated with fewer salmon losses to harbour seal predation.
Modifying anti-predator nets is an identified action to reduce predation at aquaculture systems.
No studies have directly evaluated the effects of modifying anti-predator nets on marine or freshwater mammals.
Minimizing food waste at aquaculture systems is an identified action to reduce predation.
No studies have directly evaluated the effects of minimizing food waste at aquaculture systems on marine or freshwater mammals.
Modifying aquaculture gear is an identified action to reduce predation.
No studies have directly evaluated the effects of modifying aquaculture gear on marine or freshwater mammals.
Translocating mammals away from aquaculture systems is an identified action to reduce predation.
Two studies reported that more than half or nearly all translocated Australian and New Zealand fur seals returned to salmon farms.
